org.castor.ddl
Class MappingHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.castor.ddl.MappingHelper

public class MappingHelper
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles all common tasks for manipulating Mapping document

Author:
Le Duc Bao

resolveTypeReferenceForIds

public final java.lang.String[] resolveTypeReferenceForIds(org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.ClassMapping cm)
                                                    throws GeneratorException
collect and return type of identities for a class mapping. It also takes care on the multiple column identities and extended classes

Parameters:
cm - class mapping
Returns:
list of type of reference ids from class name
Throws:
GeneratorException - an exception

resolveTypeReferenceForIds

public final java.lang.String[] resolveTypeReferenceForIds(java.lang.String className)
                                                    throws GeneratorException
Return an array of type of reference table. In case the table A refers to table B, table B refers to table C, it should call resolveTypeReference recursively. For example, 
 <mapping>
   <class name="myapp.OtherProductGroup" >
     <map-to table="other_prod_group" xml="group" />
     <field name="id" type="integer" identity="true">
       <sql name="id" type="integer"/>
     </field>
   </class>
 
   <class name="myapp.ProductGroup" identity="id">
     <map-to table="prod_group" xml="group" />
     <field name="id" type="myapp.OtherProductGroup" >
       <sql name="prod_id" />
     </field>
   </class>
 
   <class name="myapp.Product" identity="id">
     <field name="group" type="myapp.ProductGroup">
       <sql name="group_id" />
     </field>
   </class>
 </mapping>

Parameters:
className - class name
Returns:
list of type of reference ids from class name
Throws:
GeneratorException - generator error

isUseFieldIdentity

public final boolean isUseFieldIdentity(org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.ClassMapping cm)
If the ClassMapping uses identity in the FieldMapping

Parameters:
cm - class mapping
Returns:
true if this class uses the field identity

isIdentity

public final boolean isIdentity(org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.ClassMapping cm,
                                org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.FieldMapping fm)
check if fm is an identity 
  <class name="myapp.ProductGroup" identity="id">
      <field name="id" type="integer" >
          <sql name="id1 id2" type="integer"/>
      </field>
  </class>
  




Parameters:
cm - class mapping
fm - field mapping

Returns:
true if fm is an identity

getClassMappingSqlIdentity

public final java.lang.String[] getClassMappingSqlIdentity(org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.ClassMapping cm,
                                                           boolean processExt)
The identity definitions at class and field are alternative syntax. If both are specified the one at field should take precedence over the class one. In other words if both are specified the one at class will be ignored.

Parameters:
cm - Class mapping
processExt - is recursive
Returns:
list of sql identity

getClassMappingIdentity

public final java.lang.String[] getClassMappingIdentity(org.exolab.castor.mapping.xml.ClassMapping cm)
The identity definitions at class and field are alternative syntax. If both are specified the one at field should take precedence over the class one. In other words if both are specified the one at class will be ignored.

Parameters:
cm - Class mapping
Returns:
list of identity
